text: [Music]
[Applause]
last year at this time I was on a
four-day trip to Pyongyang North Korea
right now behind me you can hear all of
the singers and dancers preparing for a
communal song's birthday which is in a
few days the video I made there has more
than 12 million views and it's really
what kicked off my video making career
almost finished with the race a few
months after I left North Korea otto
warmbier who was held hostage for
stealing a poster in the same hotel I
stayed at was sent home in a coma and
shortly after passed away that horrific
incident combined with North Korea's
nuclear threats and Trump's ban on all
Americans to visit the country have
stirred a lot of controversy over the
last year it's bizarre to think that I'm
one of the last 100 or so Americans to
set foot in North Korea things seem to
be getting better though after North and
South Korea teamed up for the Olympics
and Kim Jong Un's apparent visit to the
White House next month to meet with
Trump but I am making this video today
to share with you my thoughts on North
Korea which are still parallel to my
initial reactions after my first visit
long story short
North Korea on the ground is not what
you think so it's actually a pretty
chill place people just kind of hanging
out on the streets walking I can speak
Korean and I used my ability to speak
with locals as Iran in the Pyongyang
marathon I observed their day-to-day
life in the underground metro
I witnessed kids walking to school
people going to work playing sports
outside playing sports inside performing
in the circus and I even drink beer with
people on the street many educated
Koreans can speak English because they
learned in school
mr. mustard some are excellent musicians
while others will make you smile the
bottom line is that they're people just
like you and me I am NOT oblivious that
horrible things such as labor camps are
happening outside of Pyongyang I also
realized that I was on a heavily
organised and guided tour which offered
a very skewed perspective of some
realities that may exist but my eyes
didn't lie to me and the people I met in
North Korea were innocent and friendly I
urge you not to make opinions on an
entire country of 25 million people
based on the actions of one dictator
would I go back to North Korea if the
American tourist visa is revoked
probably not I'm a little worried that
some high up officials have seen my
viral video and therefore my name is
blacklisted somewhere I just don't want
to take the risk but I do not regret
going as it was the most eye-opening
trip of my life if you ask me
there is no question that North Korea is
the most interesting country in the
world
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
